text:
83 yo M with a PMH of HTN and HLD who developed abrupt onset L sided
   weakness, was taken to an OSH and given TPA, and then transferred to
   [**Hospital1 1**] for further management. Upon arrival to the [**Hospital1 1**] ED, he had a
   persistent dense L hemiplegia as well as significant dysarthria. Repeat
   imaging of his head showed no bleeding or vessel obstruction, therefore
   no arterial interventions could be performed.  The patient continued to
   have L hemiplegia, slurred speech, and then failed a speech and swallow
   evaluation so he was started on tube feeds via NGT.  Per his family,
   the pt was unable to speak, but was communicating with them up to 1 day
   prior to his ICU transfer, at which time he became less communicative.
   On the morning of [**1-15**], the patient developed hypoxia with saturation
   of 79% on RA. He was suctioned with return of tube feedings. He was
   placed on NRB with oxygen saturation of 90-95%. An ABG revealed PaO2 of
   67, at which point the patient was transferred to the MICU and
   intubated.  Pt now thought to have aspiration PNA r/t stroke and
   aspiration of TF.
   EVENTS:  PEG placed at bedside this AM. Pt received 10mg vecuronium and
   lg amts sedation. PEG ok to use for meds, but otherwise should be to
   gravity for 24 hrs post placement (until 10am [**1-18**]).
   Pneumonia, aspiration
   Assessment:
   Pt requiring sxning q2hrs for moderate amts thick yellow/tan, blood
   tinged sputum. Gag remains very weak but pt has strong cough while
   being suctioned. Febrile to 101.8 today. Chest xray this AM showing
   worsening PNA.
   Action:
   Aggressive pulm toilet/ frequent suctioning. Pt on vanc/ceftaz for
   coverage of MRSA. Repeat sputem sample sent. Per team, pt to have
   bronchoscopy tomorrow.
   Response:
   Sats 92-97%. Pt intermittently put on CMV for PEG placement, but weaned
   back to PSV 40%/[**4-25**] and tolerating well.
   Plan:
   Plan for RSBI overnoc and SBT. Extubation temporarily planned for
   tomorrow pending pt
s MS and ability to gag/cough.
   Fever (Hyperthermia, Pyrexia, not Fever of Unknown Origin)
   Assessment:
   Pt with temp 101.1 @ 08, 101.5 @ 12, 101.8 @ 1400.
   Action:
   Blood cultures x2 (peripheral and arterial), urine, and sputem cultures
   all resent. 650mg Tylenol given via PEG. Pt cont on Vanco and ceftaz
   for coverage of MRSA. Ice packs applied to groin/armpits in attempt to
   reduce fever.
   Response:
   Cultures with no growth to date. Cont with IV abx. Temp down to 99.8 @
   1730.
   Plan:
   Cont to monitor temps. Cont with IV abx. F/U re: culture results.
